Problem:
Analyze the effect of an integral transformation on a function's Fourier transform. Suppose we have a function \\( g(x) = \\sin(x) \\) and we apply the transformation \\( T(g)(x) = \\int_0^x g(t) dt \\). Consider the Fourier transform \\( \\mathcal{F} \\) as applied on both \\( g(x) \\) and \\( T(g)(x) \\).

Given the Fourier transform of a transformed function \\( \\mathcal{F}(T(g))(\\omega) \\), can one unequivocally deduce whether the transformation \\( T \\) or an equivalent operation was applied to \\( g(x) \\)?
Explanation: While differences in the Fourier transform \\( \\mathcal{F}(T(g))(\\omega) \\) relative to \\( \\mathcal{F}(g)(\\omega) \\) can indicate changes, they do not uniquely confirm that the integral transformation \\( T \\) was applied, as different transformations can lead to similar spectral changes.
